title: Justin Wolfers Says AI's Soaring Energy Demand Is Like Egg Shortage - But Predicts Market Will 'Hatch More Watts' As Prices Rise
description: Economist Justin Wolfers likened the surge in electricity demand from artificial intelligence to a temporary "egg shortage," predicting that rising prices will drive investment and expand power generation, ultimately stabilizing the energy market.
content:
Economist Justin Wolfers compared the current surge in electricity demand driven by artificial intelligence to a temporary "egg shortage," arguing that rising prices will spur new investment and stabilize power supply over time.

title: He Once Grazed Cattle - Now He’s Using AI to Save His Mother Tongue
description: In India, many ancient and native languages have long struggled to maintain their identity within the larger linguistic ecosystem of the country. One of them has been the Ho language, spoken by the tribal communities in Jharkhand and Odisha. But thanks to artificial intelligence, the language is finding a new lease of life. Dr Bikram Biruly, a scholar who once grazed cattle while practising his native script on a slate, is now pioneering the use of AI to preserve his mother tongue.
content: Many ancient and native languages in India have long struggled to maintain their identity within the larger and ever-changing linguistic ecosystem of the country. One of them has been the Ho language, spoken by the tribal communities in Jharkhand and... [1865 chars]

title: How artificial intelligence is reshaping global infectious disease detection
description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, AI-assisted sequencing pipelines were instrumental in tracking SARS-CoV-2 variants, reconstructing outbreak dynamics, and supporting vaccine strategy development. The authors note that these same frameworks are now being repurposed for diseases such as avian influenza, Ebola, and tuberculosis.
content: Artificial intelligence is emerging as one of the most transformative technologies in modern medicine, reshaping how infectious diseases are detected, tracked, and managed across the world. A new study titled “Artificial Intelligence in Infectious Di... [6683 chars]

title: UK TV channel deploys AI host for current affairs
description: A British television channel became the latest from around the world to use an artificial intelligence (AI) presenter, in a programme airing Monday about the emergent technology's growing impact. The publicly-owned, privately-funded channel claimed the stunt was a first for British TV. "The use of an AI presenter is not something we will be making a habit of at Channel 4," its head of news and current affairs Louisa Compton said in a statement.
content:

title: Stressed by H-1B process, Indian-origin techie is using AI to simplify work-visa filing
description: America’s visa system is notoriously complex, and Priyanka Kulkarni knows it better than most. The 34-year-old machine learning scientist spent nine years juggling the visa process herself. Now, she’s using artificial intelligence to help others handle work-based immigration smoothly and hassle-free. | financialexpress.com

title: Game-changer for poultry health: AI cuts vaccine development time from months to days
description: The researchers argue that traditional vaccine development methods, which rely heavily on laboratory experimentation and long lead times, are no longer sufficient to handle rapidly mutating avian viruses such as avian influenza (H5N1), Newcastle disease virus (NDV), and infectious bronchitis virus (IBV). By integrating machine learning, deep learning, and immunoinformatics, the team demonstrates that artificial intelligence can significantly shorten vaccine design cycles while improving safety, precision, and immune response prediction.
content:
In a major advancement for veterinary science, a team of researchers has proposed an artificial intelligence–driven framework that could redefine how avian viral vaccines are designed and developed.

title: How artificial intelligence will redefine Industry 5.0
description: The authors argue that AI is the structural enabler of this paradigm shift. It combines machine learning, big data, the Internet of Things (IoT), and intelligent robotics to enhance operational efficiency while personalizing production systems. The result is an industrial ecosystem that adapts dynamically to human needs, resource availability, and market demands.
content:
A new study outlines a transformative vision for the next industrial era, Industry 5.0, driven by artificial intelligence (AI) and defined by collaboration between humans and machines.

description: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. made its steepest-ever job cuts as strained ties with the US and a rapid shift toward artificial intelligence reshape the country's $280 billion IT services sector.
